OOC: Okay, since everyone lost track of Megatron anyways, I am going to
say he was in the base the whole time. (Sorry for the long time of
inactivity Perceptor)

BIC:

Megatron's chambre was dully light, with purple lights, giving it an
ominous glow the tyrant enjoyed. With a pained expression he pulled
himself up, and quickly glanced at one of the moniters in front of him.
The ship was in movement, (good) he thought to himself. (We won't be
vulnerable for much longer, but where is Havotron?) it wasnt time to
meet the Decepticon yet, that's why he had pulled back, but instead of
Havotron, the Constructicons and Soundwave dominated the screen. (Old
friends? Or enemies?) He mused to himself. He pushed his arms outwards,
grabing hold of the sides of his recharger, and pulled himself up, a
weary whine emited from his back joint. Then he realised his appointed
bodyguards were still with him. (Good) he thought. (Never hurts to be
careful) but he then realised why they were worried. (The Vision. What
was it, my brother?) Megatron understood it very little, probably as
much as Blindchaos and Dominjoe would if he explained it to them. He
must have a circuit loose in his head, he would have to get it checked
by Switchblade later. That he did not relish. He pulled himself up, and
stood, creaking his neck. He looked at his two soldiers, then back at
the screen.

"There must be a good reason those traitors stayed around the battle
field, we must go investigate, Dominjoe, transform." he ordered, as he
himself leapt to the air, folding and shrinking into his gun mode,
falling towards Blindchaos. <Easier to transport me this way no :)>

The computer replayed Megatron's silent message. "Perceptor, old friend,
meet us back at the Hudson Bay."
